pre-task.applicable-cars: C Car, S Car, T Car

list-item.para: Communication Control Unit powered and active.

activity.title: Install Communication Control Unit Software Package

hazard.hazard-desc: If performing the activities of this procedure determines that corrective maintenance is required, report it to supervision to ensure that proper corrective action is taken.
Communication Control Unit (CCU) software service procedure is typical and also applies to destination signs.
When performing maintenance, finding access doors unlocked on normally-secured lockers or cabinets must be reported to supervisor.

step.para: Unlock and open locker L1 access door using NJ Transit coach key.
Remove electronics rack shield/cover

hazard.hazard-desc: Cables connected to locker equipment can cause electrical shock. Exercise care whenever accessing any of the electrical lockers. Failure to do so may result in injury or death.
The following steps are performed while some locker equipment may be powered. Exercise care whenever near powered equipment. Failure to do so may result in injury or death.
CCU software may be updated using PCMCIA card, PTE, or MDU. PCMCIA card is the fastest way to update software, followed by the PTE, and finally by the MDU. Update CCU software using only one method.
Updating software using MDU may be very long for large data and is practically only used for very small software package.

activity.title: Update CCU Software Using PCMCIA Card

step.para: Ensure that no files CCU_DYZ.tar.gz or XYZ.lzw are in root directory of PCMCIA card. If present, move files to another folder or delete.
Copy software update package onto root directory of compatible PCMCIA card.
Insert PCMCIA card into PCMCIA slot on CCU front panel.

hazard.hazard-desc: PCMCIA LED blinks quickly to indicate that CCU is looking for Software Configuration Item (SCI) update package. When LED blinks slowly, it means that CCU is beginning to update software package.

step.para: Once PCMCIA LED stops blinking, remove PCMCIA card and proceed to activity “Verify Software Update and Close Locker”.
Connect PTE COM port to CCU Port using serial cable.
Using PTE Windows, reach Network and Dial-up Connections and double-click PTE connection to CCU (possibly named CCU PTE) to reach PTE CCU main page.
In CCU PTE main page left menu, click on SCI Update to reach SCI Update screen.
To upload SCI package onto CCU, click link “> Click Here” to open standard browser window.

illustration.title: CCU PTE - SCI Update, Upload in CCU

step.para: Use mouse to drag the SCI update package in ftp folder window.
Wait until all softwares in SCI software package are uploaded and transfer completed.

hazard.hazard-desc: Depending on which software is installed, it can take several minutes for update and CCU may reboot by itself once updated.

step.para: Click Start SCI Update button at bottom of SCI Update screen to start update.
Put software update in following directory of PCMCIA Card: \ml\swpkg\
Insert PCMCIA card with access to Engineering Area, in MCU slot.
From MDU Train Overview screen, press softkey Eng. Area.
From MDU Engineering Area screen, press softkey Software Update.

From MDU Software Update - Software package Selection screen, use MDU navigation keys to select car system CCU PCMCIA software packages, click PCMCIA softkey button in Source Media group, then click MDU key E to accept.
From MDU Software Update - SCIs To Update screen, click Select All softkey button under Select Car System group, then click Start Update softkey button.
Watch software update progress from MDU Software Update - Status screen, clicking Confirm Install softkey button as required.

activity.title: Verify Software Update and Close Locker

step.para: Reboot CCU following SCI Package update.

illustration.title: CCU PTE - SCI Update, SCI Version

step.para: Verify SCI Version numbers with PTE to ensure that the updates are successful using "SCI Versions" in left menu.
Verify log with PTE using "Get Event Log" in left menu to ensure that no errors occurred during software upload.
Remove PCMCIA Card Key if used.
Replace electronics rack shield/cover.
Close and lock locker L1 access door using NJ Transit coach key.

follow-on-tasks.para: Perform CCU Power-up Test. Refer to BOM00764H.
